twcore.bots.twl
Class PlayerLagInfo

java.lang.Object
  twcore.bots.twl.GameComponent
      twcore.bots.twl.PlayerInfo
          twcore.bots.twl.PlayerLagInfo

public class PlayerLagInfo
extends PlayerInfo

This class retrieves detailed lag information about a certain player. The following stats are obtained: Current, Average, Low, and High Ping C2S, S2C, and S2CWeapons packetloss Number and percent of C2S and S2C Slow packets. The standard deviation and number of spikes. This class obtains this information by parsing *info, and *tinfo. The spike information is for the last 160 seconds of play. If the player has not been in the game for at least 3 minutes, then the standard deviation and number of spikes will both be 0. When figuring out what the spike is, this class will check if consecutive tinfo values are over a certain number of milliseconds. This number can be specified in the constructor of the class. The *info and *tinfo commands are synchronized so it is safe to put this class into different threads on the same bot. Because it is synchronized, other * commands will not be placed inbetween these 3 commands. Updated 08/10/03 by Cpt.Guano! - Parsed all of the ping / ploss information out of *info instead of *lag.

Version:
1.1, 08/10/03
Author:
Cpt.Guano!

Constructor Detail

PlayerLagInfo

public PlayerLagInfo(BotAction botAction,
                     java.lang.String playerName,
                     int spikeSize,
                     LogWriter logFile)
This method initializes a PlayerLag class. It tracks the lag of a player. The object is created using a spike size that is passed as a parameter.

Parameters:
botAction - is the botAction of the bot.
playerName - is the name of the player whose lag info this is.
spikeSize - is the minimum ping jump required to make a spike.
logFile - is the log file to write events to.

                     java.lang.String playerName,
                     int spikeSize)

                     java.lang.String playerName,
                     LogWriter logFile)
This method initializes a PlayerLag class. It tracks the lag of a player. The object is created using the default spike size.

Parameters:
botAction - is the botAction of the bot.
playerName - is the name of the player whose lag info this is.

getSpikeSD

public double getSpikeSD()
This method returns the standard deviation of the players tinfo. The value that it returns is in miliseconds.

Returns:
the standard deviation of the spike is returned.

getSpikeSize

public int getSpikeSize()
This method returns the spike size (The number of ms jump that is considered a spike).

Returns:
the spikeSize is returned.

getNumSpikes

public int getNumSpikes()
This method returns the number of spikes that the player has recently experienced. A spike is defined as a ping jump over spikeSize.

Returns:
the number of spikes recently made by the player.

reset

public void reset()
This sets the PlayerLagInfo class to the state of not having checked the players lag.

Specified by:
reset in class PlayerInfo

updateLag

public void updateLag()
This method updates the players lag information. It is synchronized so that the *info and *tinfo commands are not interrupted.
